attributes.action: To push for the five permanent members of the U.N Security Council to give up their Veto's.
attributes.additional_details: For Britain to push to give up its veto and put pressure on the other countries of the U.N Security Council permanent members to give up their veto's and let the majority vote win which is how democracy works and bring about a long overdue reform of the U.N.So that the self interests of the five permanent members STOPS the inaction of the U.N resolutions and the cost of lives around the globe. As the veto does at this point, let it be that the evidence is brought forward by the experts and respective parties and debated and then voted on with no veto and then acted on after the vote is made.
